subject: Photography
title: Street Portraits vs. Street Photography
description: A quick, practical guide to Street Portraits vs. Street Photography.

hook.text: One is candid, the other is consensual. Street portraits and street photography share a name but differ in approach.

buildup.text: Street photography captures unknowing subjects in public. Street portraits approach strangers and ask to photo them.

discovery.text: Street portraits offer eye contact, connection, and cooperation. The subject becomes a collaborator, not a bystander.

twist.text: Approaching a stranger takes courage. Most photographers find it terrifying at first â€” and addictive afterward.

climax.text: Both genres reveal humanity. One captures it secretly; the other through a brief, shared human moment.

punchline.text: One steals the moment. The other asks for it.

quiz.question: What distinguishes street portraits from candid street photography?
options: Street portraits involve approaching and asking strangers to participate
